text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with dark chocolate macaron that's
right I don't really probably boo the
francais very good but I don't think
that was too bad they are not macaroons
those are those coconut cookies these
are little French meringues we make this
little cookie sandwich out of these were
extremely trendy a few years ago but of
course I had to wait till it was uncool
to make these before we made these and
by the way I should warn you this is the
first time I ever made them so I have no
idea what I'm doing so here we go we're
gonna start with the dry ingredients
which is powdered sugar ground almonds
also known as almond meal or almond
flour and some dark cocoa now one thing
I did here is you want this dry mixture
to be as lump-free as possible so I
found this box of powdered sugar I think
it was from like the Clinton
administration it was really lumpy so I
put mine through a fine screen here I'm
going to sift that you want it really
really fine all right no chunks no lumps
just like that all right next we're
going to make our meringue which is
simply egg whites room temperature no
yolks at all in a very clean Bowl you're
going to turn that on and you're just
going to mix it until it's frothy and it
looks like that
then with the speed set to high we're
gonna start sprinkling in our granulated
sugar a few teaspoons at a time until
it's all in and after all the granulated
sugar is in you're going to continue to
beat that on high until we have peaks
how stiff I'm not sure I went to this
stage all right the peak did flop over
but then it was pretty stiff at that
point I read bad things happen if you
over mix the whites so I was afraid so I
stopped right there and it seemed to be
fine but they should be very thick very
glossy and definitely be able to hold a
peak like that okay now I transfer this
into another Bowl so it's easier to film
you can leave yours right in the bowl
you mix them then we're going to add
half the dry mixture and fold it in with
a spatula now I'm using the classic
folding method of scraping down under
the mixture and over the top I'm also
using the tip of the spatula to kind of
stir gently basically we're trying to
get these dry ingredients in without
completely deflating the egg whites so I
put in half as soon as the first half's
in you're going to put in the second
half and do the same thing until it's
combined and once it's incorporated stop
stop mixing you don't need to mix it any
more please stop
at that point I'm going to transfer my
mixture into a plastic piping bag I use
a drinking glass to hold it up because I
have no friends so if you're working
alone just use a glass to hold your bag
while you scrape the batter in so since
I'm using plastic disposable piping bags
I'm going to snip off the end and then
I'm going to go over to my sheet tray
which is lined with parchment paper and
I'm going to pipe out little circles
those are about the size of a half
dollar by the way when's the last time
you had a half dollar in your pocket
alright so we're going to pipe those out
now after you pipe them you're going to
have that little peak on there
you're supposed to knock that down or
push that over I used a spoon as I had
cocoa all over my fingers they look
dirty alright once those are piped we
got to give the old tap a tappa to kind
of flatten them out a little bit and
then we're going to put those in a 350
degree oven for six minutes then I'm
going to switch positions in the oven
and then I'm going to give those about
another six or seven minutes until done
and look how gorgeous so about 60% of
mine came out perfect and we're going to
talk about that on the blog post so some
look like that perfect smooth surface
beautiful little feet which is what they
call that little ring around the bottom
so most of them are like that but then
some look like this but that's okay this
is my first attempt but regardless of
what the surface look like on some the
texture was perfect they should be
crispy kind of crackly on the outside
and then soft and chewy and kind of cake
like in the middle in fact let me switch
to a photo here because I think I'm
making you dizzy so you can see that
alright so we're gonna go ahead and let
those cool completely while we make our
filling I'm just doing a simple ganache
I took some dark chocolate a little sea
salt hot cream and you just mix it up
and when it melts and turns into this
awesome shiny mixture you let it cool
just until it's thick enough to handle
you flip one of the cookies over you put
some on you press the other one down and
you have these amazing cute little
meringue cookie sandwiches they're just
adorable
what's French for adorable I bet it's so
adorable and just for a little extra
fanciness we're going to do a little
dusting of cocoa even though most of my
tops were beautiful
it still can cover up some of the minor
flaws so pretty and there we go dark
chocolate macarons
and of course feel free to call
macaroons that's what most people call
them all right let me bite into one of
these you know all I can say really is
ooh la la we have a very high-end French
PCEHR down the street and these are
comparable I know I can't believe it
either but anyway I hope this inspires
you to give these formerly very trendy
cookies a try they are really fun to
make and incredibly delicious so head
over to food wishes calm for all the
ingredient amounts some given in grams
so you Europeans have that to look
forward to there will also be some more
information as usual and as always enjoy
